title: Graphs
text: First is a scatter plot showing with color the percentage of healthcare staff currently (as of the week ending 12/10/23) fully vaccinated for covid, with the horizontal axis showing the percentage of residents fully vaccinated and the vertical axis showing the number of residents who died from covid, normalized over the number of residents through time (these data all come directly from https://data.cms.gov/covid-19/covid-19-nursing-home-data). There are histograms after that for counts. You can use the sliders and checkboxes below to filter facilities. Clicking on any point will show detail on the facility.

Note



Some of these rates look remarkably high. From the FAQ at https://data.cms.gov/covid-19/covid-19-nursing-home-data:
How can there be more confirmed COVID-19 cases than beds in a nursing home?
The nursing home data posted reflects cumulative cases and deaths of COVID-19 reported in a facility. A nursing home may report more confirmed COVID-19 cases than beds because they may encounter a large number of admissions and discharges of residents with COVID-19, resulting in more cumulative cases of COVID-19 over time than the number of beds at any one time.
This may also be due to a data entry error on the part of the facility – for example, a nursing home may be entering cumulative numbers of confirmed COVID-19 cases in a field where the facility should only be entering the number of new cases.



Next are a histogram showing the counts of nursing homes with different proportions of healthcare staff or residents fully vaccinated fully vaccinated for covid.

title: Table
text:

title: Nursing home covid
text:
The US Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services puts out a dataset of covid incidence, deaths, and vaccination at 13751 US nursing homes. The data are available at https://data.cms.gov/covid-19/covid-19-nursing-home-data. It has info on individual nursing homes, but it can be a little hard to use. I am making it more usable here, trying to make it easier for folks to see how people in nursing homes are being cared for. This uses federal data from the week ending 12/10/23.
The tabs above have different views of the data. Some quick summaries:

6029 nursing homes have zero healthcare staff fully up to date on covid vaccines.
72 nursing homes have all healthcare staff fully up to date on covid vaccines.
3655 nursing homes have zero residents fully up to date on covid vaccines.
95 nursing homes have all residents fully up to date on covid vaccines.

title: Map
text:
This is a map showing all the facilities that had data which the federal government believes passed a quality assurance check and which US census data could provide a latitude and longitude for given the facility’s street address. Color shows the percentage of healthcare staff currently (as of the week ending 12/10/23 ) fully vaccinated for covid (purple is 100% vaccinated, yellow is 0% vaccinated). You can use the sliders and checkboxes below to filter facilities. Clicking on any point will show detail on the facility. Click on a point to get all the data for that facility. The map is zoomed out to show the lower 48 states, but you can zoom in to see individual facilities and move and zoom to see other US states and territories.

title: About
text:
This uses data from https://data.cms.gov/covid-19/covid-19-nursing-home-data .
The site is made with quarto and R: the source code is at https://github.com/bomeara/nursinghomecovid . It uses the targets, readr, tidyverse, tidygeocoder, reactable, stringr, crosstalk, plotly, and leaflet packages.
It was made by Brian O’Meara. I’m a biologist, but this is outside my area of expertise: I do not know what vaccination rate is ideal in this setting, what covid rates are considered an acceptable tradeoff, biases in the reporting, and more. I’m just trying to make the data more accessible so that families can make informed decisions and journalists can dig into the data to see if there is anything of interest (facilities doing an exceptionally good or bad job, for example). I came across this dataset online and was surprised at how many facilities have no residents nor health care workers fully vaccinated against covid-19, given over 170,000 deaths in nursing homes in the US (as of Dec 22, 2023). To get in touch with an issue, go to https://github.com/bomeara/nursinghomecovid/issues. For issues with the original data, go to https://data.cms.gov/covid-19/covid-19-nursing-home-data.
To run this yourself, go to https://github.com/bomeara/nursinghomecovid, clone the repository, and then source run.R to run quarto to make the site. Make sure you have the packages listed above installed.
